full_summary:
### Steam Turbine Request for Proposal Treaty Notice
#### Posting Reference
WS4452021269
#### Title
W0114-230003 Steam Turbine (B)

#### Request for Proposal General Information
- **Request Reference**: WS4452021269
- **Date Published**: April 11th, 2024
- **Tender Closing Date**: Must be received by May 17th, 2024 2PM EDT

#### Request for Proposal Summary
The Government of Canada is seeking offers from qualified offerors to provide a new steam turbine power system and software for data recording at the Royal Military College of Canada (RMC). The selection criteria will be based on the "Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price".

#### Contracting Entity and End-User Information
- **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
- **End User**: Royal Military College of Canada (RMCC)

#### Notice Information
- **Notice URL**: <https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19377578>
- **Contact Information**: Jason Scott, Contact for: <jason.scott@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca>

#### Bidding Details
- **Procurement Method**: Competitive Bidding
- **Trade Agreements**: Open to Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) trade partners

#### Notice Terms and Conditions
This notice cancels and supersedes the previous solicitation number WS4273656557 dated November 9th, 2023, with a closing date of December 21st, 2023. Bids received after 2:00 PM EDT of the closing date will be declared non-responsive. A debriefing or feedback session will be provided upon request to offerors who offered on the previous solicitation.

Please disregard the Ariba Discovery posting response deadline and CanadaBuys posting closing time. All supporting documentation and bids must be submitted by May 17th, 2024. Interested parties are advised to carefully review the bidding details and requirements.

National Master Contract No: WS4452021269 
Gathering tender documents and plans might help facilitate this procure process.

With over two decades of experience in energy production, the Royal Military College of Canada is looking to revamp its steam turbine system, and in turn boost the nation's renewable energy capabilities. One business has offered their expertise and services competitive rates.



### [Nature of the information - Coming from Canadian public service
Category : Mandatory Submission Notice ]
